internal.content:
--- title: API-enabled application integration 300-level live demo description: API-enabled application integration tabs: [ 'Demo preparation', 'Demo script'] --- export const Title = () => ( API-enabled application integration
300-level live demo ); ![banner](./images/300-int-API-enabled-prep-GitHub-banner-8-3-21-short.jpg) ### **WARNING**:     May 11, 2022. This demonstration’s 1-click installation occasionally fails. Should errors occur, please raise a ticket on the IBM Support Portal mentioning “1 click install”. We are working very closely with support, who will assist you in getting your environment running. | DEMO OVERVIEW | | | --------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------- | | **Scenario overview** | Access applications through APIs and integrations. Use Watson AI together with SaaS connectivity to Salesforce and ServiceNow to create a self-service car repair API giving customers real-time estimates and integrating directly with record systems. The demo shows easy API creation with no-code App Connect Designer, rate limiting plans, security policies and self-service API consumption using the API Connect portal. | | **Demo products** | Cloud Pak for Integration | | **Demo capabilities** | IBM App Connect Enterprise; IBM App Connect Enterprise Designer; API Connect (APIC) | | **Demo guidance** | This demo script has multiple tasks that each have multiple steps. In each step, you have the details about what you need to do (**Actions**), what you can say while delivering this demo step (**Narration**), and what diagrams and screenshots you will see.

This demo script is a suggestion, and you are welcome to customize based on your sales opportunity. Most importantly, practice this demo in advance. If the demo seems easy for you to execute, the customer will focus on the content. If it seems difficult for you to execute, the customer will focus on your delivery. | | **Required versions** | Cloud Pak for Integration V2021.3 | | **How to get support** | Contact #itz-techzone-support or techzone.help@ibm.com regarding issues with reserving and provisioning TechZone environments.

Contact #platinumdemos-automation-support regarding issues with setting up and running this demo use case. | ### **DEMO INSTALLATION AND SETUP**
1 - Provision a Cloud Pak for Integration environment
Install Cloud Pak for Integration, or provision a ROKS environment. To reserve your ROKS instance, follow these steps:

1. To reserve a preinstalled Cloud Pak for Integration (CP4I) ROKS 4.6 cluster on Red Hat OpenShift, go here and complete the form. (If you do not have a sales opportunity, select the purpose **Practice / Self-Education** to create a two-week reservation.)
NOTE If there are no clusters availabile in Express installation, go ahead with the Custom installation. While the process is the same, Express is a 5 minute request (because you will receive a pre-created ROKS cluster from a queue), and custom is a 2 hour provisioning (because the ROKS cluster will be installed, behind the scenes, from scratch for you).
2. You will receive a confirmation email confirming the instance is provisioning.

3. You will receive a second email once the environment is provisioned. You should expect this to take about 30 minutes. This email contains information, such as URLs, allowing you to connect to the instance.
If you have issues connecting to your instance, please contact #itz-techzone-support.



**[Go to top](#top)**
2 - Install Cloud Pak for Integration on ROKS cluster
1. Click on the **Cluster URL** from the enviroment confirmation email. Log into IBM Cloud using your IBMid.

2. After you are logged in, click here to install Cloud Pak for Integration.

Make sure you are in an **ITZ** account (1) and the **Product version** is 2021.4.1-0 (2).

3. Scroll down to the **Select your cluster** section. From the list, select the Redhat Openshift Cluster (1) that you just created. Then click **Add project** (2).


4. Enter **cp4i** as the **Project** (1) name. Click **Add** (2).


5. Scroll down to the **Set the deployment values** section and toggle the **Use an existing secret?** slider to **no** (1). Enter a value for csDefaultAdminPassword (2). It is important that you choose a password that is 32 characters in length and is composed of only letters and numbers. You will need this password in step 12.
NOTE: Currently password validation is not enforced on this page. If you proceed with an invalid password you will be able to start the installation but it will fail. There is no way to recover from this error other than provisioning a new cluster.

6. Scroll down to **Parameters with default values**. Click the collapsible section to open them. First, we will select the appropriate parameter for this specific demo.
| FIELD | ACTION | | ------ | ------- | | **cognitiveCarRepairDemo:** | Set to ‘true’ | | **drivewayDentDeletionDemo:** | Set to ‘false’ | | **eventEnabledInsuranceDemo:** | Set to ‘false’ | | **mappingAssistDemo:** | Set to ‘false’ | | **weatherChatbotDemo:** | Set to ‘false’ |

7. Continue to change the default values parameters using the table below.
If you don't have an SMTP email server and accounts that you can use, you may sign up for a free Mailtrap.io account. Mailtrap.io is a free cloud service that mimics an SMTP server. It is used for development/demonstration purposes only.
| FIELD | ACTION | | ------ | ------- | | **demoAPICMailServerHost:** (1)| If you’re using mailtrap, leave this smtp.mailtrap.io. | | **demoAPICMailServerPort:** (2)| If you’re using mailtrap, leave this as 2525. | | **demoAPICEmailAddress:** (3)| If you’re using mailtrap, you can use any email address.
The dummy address ’apicadmin@example.com’ is recommended. If you’re using your own mail server, use an email address that you can receive and read. | | **demoAPICMialServerUsername:** (4)| Set this to your mailtrap username. | | **demoAPICMailServerPassword:** (5)| Set this to your mailtrap password. |

8. Accept the license agreement and click **Install** to install Cloud Pak for Integration. The installation will take up to 90 minutes.


9. You can view the progress in the Schematics progress bar or check the details in view log.


10. When the status is **Active**, you will be able to access Cloud Pak for Integration Platform Navigator. Select **Offering Dashboard** on the upper right corner of the page.


11. On the log in page, select the authentication type **IBM provided credentials (admin only)**.


12. Log in using the admin userid and password you created in step 6.


13. Click **Integration instances**.


14. The parts of the Cloud Pak (API Connect, App Connect Designer, App Connect Dashboard and Asset Repository) will display here. Additional instances for any of the integration capabilities can be created by selecting **Create capability**.


You have successfully completed cluster provisioning, installation of Cloud Pak for Integration, and deployment of API Connect and App Connect. You are ready to proceed.
**[Go to top](#top)**
3 - Prerequisites, preparing your environment, and delivery options
NOTE The Watson Tone Analyzer referenced in preprequisites has been deprecated.
- Learn about prerequisites and preparing your environment - Check the different delivery options and be ready to deliver the demo - Download the [demo slides](./slides.pptx)
**[Go to top](#top)**
Click [here](/300-integration/demo-script) to go to the **Demo script** on the next tab.
